title: UEFA statement after meeting to discuss Platini case
text:
UEFA statement after meeting to discuss Platini case THE ASSOCIATED PRESS   1:01 pmLast   1:01 pm   
Subjects: 

NYON, Switzerland — Statement from UEFA after emergency meeting to discuss UEFA President Michel Platini's case: 
UEFA's Executive Committee and UEFA's 54 national association met today at the House of European Football in Nyon, Switzerland. The discussions centred on a variety of issues relating to UEFA President Michel Platini. At the end of the meetings, the following statement was agreed: 
"We support Michel Platini's right to a due process and a fair trial and to the opportunity to clear his name." 
"We strongly call on all instances involved in the current process: FIFA's Ethics Committee, FIFA's Appeal Committee and ultimately the Court of Arbitration for Sport to work very rapidly to ensure that there is a final decision on the merits of the case by, at the latest, mid-November 2015."
